title: Environmentalists, tuna fisheries clash over Indian Ocean temporary ban on driftnets
description: The European bloc had opposed a resolution by the Indian Ocean Tuna Commission imposing a temporary ban on driftnets. Fisheries devices are used to catch 90% of tuna sold in the EU.

title: Attorney predicts quick Alex Murdaugh acquittal because defendant 'humanized' himself on stand
description: Former South Carolina 14th Circuit District Solicitor Alex Murdaugh's murder trial continues to garner contrasting analysis, including from one attorney predicting an acquittal.

title: Former US Senator Santorum joins North Carolina House to push constitutional convention
description: Former U.S. Sen. Rick Santorum has joined North Carolina's House GOP to push a convention of states. The Constitution requires agreement from 34 to call for a convention.

title: Karine Jean-Pierre dodges question on Lori Lightfoot's re-election loss, blames GOP for crime surge
description: White House press secretary Karine Jean-Pierre avoided a question about Lori Lightfoot's loss in the Chicago mayoral election and appeared to blame Republicans for rising crime.

title: Sen. Kennedy confronts Garland on controversial school board memo: 'What did you think was going to happen?'
description: Sen. John Kennedy, R-La., on Wednesday pressed Attorney General Merrick Garland to explain his controversial 2021 memo regarding threats to school board members.

title: Ohio state Senate greenlights education overhaul
description: A proposed overhaul of public oversight and standard-setting in K-12 education in Ohio has passed the state's Republican-dominated Senate.

title: Former Philadelphia councilman gets 3 1/2 years in massive corruption case
description: Former Philadelphia councilman Bobby Henon has been sentenced to three-and-a-half years in prison for his role in a federal public corruption case.

title: Reds' Joey Votto has out-of-this-world prediction for 2023 season
description: Cincinnati Reds first baseman Joey Votto has outdone his usual antics on and off the field with the boldest prediction ever for the 2023 MLB season

title: Kings fans rip team for Twitter send-off to recently traded 'franchise icon' Jonathan Quick: 'That's it?'
description: Los Angeles Kings legendary goalie Jonathan Quick was traded to the Columbus Blue Jackets on Tuesday, but fans aren't happy with the team's send-off.

title: NYC doles out millions to Floyd protestors claiming police assaulted them
description: New York City agreed to pay several million dollars in a legal settlement over alleged assault, abuse, and entrapment by police during the 2020 George Floyd protests.

title: Bengals exec, coach shut down Tee Higgins trade speculation: 'Find your own' wide receiver
description: Rumors have swirled that Tee Higgins, who is entering the final year of his rookie deal, could be a trade candidate as the Bengals have to soon pay Joe Burrow and Ja'Marr Chase.

title: Man suspected of cannibalism detained at airport after police found 'pieces of meat' in suitcase
description: Begoleã Mendes Fernandes allegedly murdered Alan Lopes, 21, who had accepted Fernandes into his home, believing the man was homeless. Fernandes may have used a false name.

title: Decades before woke culture, author Roald Dahl warned publishers on changes: Don’t remove a ‘single comma’
description: In a resurfaced interview, author Roald Dahl apparently anticipated woke culture. The author jokingly said he would call the Norse thunder god to punish any who did so.

title: CBO director informs House Republicans that the US debt situation is dire: sources
description: Congressional Budget Office director Phillip Swagel told members of the House Republican Study Committee that the $31.4 trillion national debt presented a dire challenge.

title: China could funnel weapons to Russia through Belarus as defense ties with Beijing deepen: expert
description: Russian President Putin's top allies, China and Belarus, met in Beijing to enhance relations as one security expert warns China could look to funnel arms to Russia through Belarus.

title: Pennsylvania man arrested after allegedly attempting to bring explosive on flight
description: A Pennsylvania man was arrested on late Monday night after he allegedly attempted to bring an explosive device onto a flight on Feb. 27.

title: Republicans probe EPA on why East Palestine waste sent to Indiana after Dems objected to Michigan
description: A pair of Indiana Republican lawmakers sent a letter to EPA Administrator Michael Regan asking why the East Palestine cleanup was paused after Democrat lawmakers complained.

title: Massachusetts veterans' home sued over COVID deaths
description: The families of three veterans who died of COVID-19 at the Chelsea Soldiers' home in Massachusetts have filed a class-action civil rights lawsuit.

title: City of Natchez appoints first female police chief
description: The city of Natchez in Mississippi has appointed its first female police chief. The board promoted her from the interim position she has held since December.

title: Chasing Horse pleads not guilty in Nevada to sex abuse case
description: Nathan Chasing Horse has pleaded not guilty in Nevada to a sex abuse case. The former "Dances With Wolves" actor accused of being the leader of a cult that takes multiple wives.

title: White House: Eli Lilly’s insulin price cap shows why GOP should stop attacking the Inflation Reduction Act
description: The White House said Eli Lilly’s move to cap out-of-pocket costs for insulin at $35 for patients shows why Republicans should stop trying to repeal the Inflation Reduction Act.

title: British police find remains of baby after missing couple arrested
description: British police have found the remains of a baby after a missing couple was arrested. The infant’s mother and her boyfriend had crisscrossed England to avoid authorities.

title: Detransitioner slams Nebraska rep for claiming transgender surgeries don’t happen in her state: 'I was 16'
description: Detransitioner Luka Hein calls out Nebraska State Senator for claiming transgender surgery "never happens" in the state, sharing photo of her scarred chest from a double mastectomy she underwent at the age of 16.

title: After 3 KC officers shot, police seek robotics, drone technology to search house
description: Three Kansas City police officers were shot while executing a search warrant at a home on Wednesday. The officers were taken to the hospital with non-life threatening injuries.

title: Chicago police superintendent David Brown announces resignation
description: Chicago's police chief announced his resignation Wednesday.

title: Senate kills Biden ESG investment rule in stunning rebuke
description: The Senate formally killed a Biden administration rule that encourages private retirement plan fiduciaries to consider ESG factors when making investment decisions for over 150 million Americans.

title: Amy Grant says she leaned on her faith after horrific bike accident: ‘It’s helped me not be afraid’
description: Amy Grant says her faith helped her get through her horrible bike accident last year that left her with a traumatic brain injury.

title: Kentucky GOP gubernatorial nominee advocates higher starting pay for Kentucky teachers
description: A Kentucky Republican is pushing for a higher starting pay for state teachers if he is elected governor. Daniel Cameron also says he will reduce their administrative paperwork.

title: Florida woman's family seeking answers after body found by fishermen in Gulf of Mexico miles from shore
description: Fishermen found Heather Strickland's body in a trash bag miles off the coast of Pinellas County, Florida, in December 2022. Her family is still awaiting justice.

title: New York firefighter dead after four-alarm fire, building collapse in Buffalo
description: A Buffalo, New York firefighter is dead following a four-alarm fire which led to a massive explosion on Wednesday morning.

title: Woman accidentally eats heart-shaped potato chip worth over $120K: 'I didn't realize'
description: Dawn Sagar of England could have been the big winner of the "Heart Shaped Crisp Hunt" – a contest launched by Walkers, which is a British snack food company.

title: Despite surplus, Wisconsin Republicans advise against spending hikes
description: Republican leaders in the Wisconsin Legislature cautioned against higher state spending Wednesday, downplaying a $7 billion budget surplus for the current fiscal year.

title: Bette Midler confesses to plastic surgery: Time smooths 'everything out'
description: "Hocus Pocus" star Bette Midler, 77, admitted she had plastic surgery after facing criticism about her appearance. She received the Distinguished Collaborator Award.

title: Georgia officials confronted with key questions as wealthy Atlanta suburb pushes to secede
description: A measure calling for an Atlanta suburb to secede and become its own city gained some traction this week.

title: Sen. Hawley grills AG Garland on anti-Catholic bias in the FBI, raid on pro-life family: ‘Give me an answer!'
description: Attorney General Merrick Garland fielded a flurry of questions from Sen. Josh Hawley, R-Mo., about whether the FBI has a bias against Catholic Americans.

title: Lori Lightfoot ripped for reportedly blaming re-election loss on race, gender: 'She's an utter failure'
description: "Outnumbered" panelists argued Wednesday that Lori Lightfoot's failure to tackle Chicago's crime crisis is the real reason she lost her bid for re-election.

title: 5 best apps to determine how much a bottle of wine gifted to you is worth
description: Wine can be really expensive — or sometimes not. If you are curious about the value of wine gifted to you, Kurt "CyberGuy" Knutsson lists five apps to help.

title: Famed African reporter reveals how he went from battling pirates and poverty to grilling Karine Jean-Pierre
description: Today News Africa reporter Simon Ateba shares his journey growing up in poverty to working in the White House breifing room on Fox Nation's 'Tucker Carlson Today.'

description: The Golden State Warriors are reportedly expecting All-Star guard Stephen Curry to return to the team sometime during their three-game road trip next week.

description: The State Department on Wednesday criticized an Israeli minister for calling for the destruction of a Palestinian village in the West Bank, calling those remarks 'disgusting.'

title: Meghan Markle, Prince Harry ‘stunned’ by King Charles’ ‘cruel’ Frogmore Cottage eviction, report says
description: A source told "Finding Freedom" author Omid Scobie that Prince Harry and Meghan Markle have "until early summer" to vacate. The home was a wedding gift from the late queen.

title: American College of OB-GYNs bans pro-life doctors from conference: 'Vague explanation'
description: The American College of Obstetricians and Gynecologists barred a group of pro-life doctors from speaking at their conference after 15 years of appearing.

title: Democrats, Republicans aim to block Biden admin's action protecting Chinese solar companies
description: Democratic and Republican lawmakers are working to pass time-sensitive legislation that would roll back a rule allowing Chinese solar panel makers to skirt U.S. trade laws.

title: Watch Karine Jean-Pierre snub DeSantis op-ed on Disney tax crackdown: 'Not going to read that'
description: White House Press Secretary Karine Jean-Pierre snubbed Republican Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' op-ed on his Disney crackdown, telling a reporter she would not read it.

title: Colorectal cancer is showing up in younger people and at more advanced stages: study
description: A new study from the American Cancer Society says that advanced stage colorectal cancer (CRC) cases are rising and the disease is being seen more frequently in younger patients.

title: Chris Pine addresses Harry Styles spitting incident in Venice, calls Twitter hype ‘ridiculous’
description: Chris Pine addressed the Harry Styles spitting video along with the overall drama between Olivia Wilde and Florence Pugh, and the fate of the "Star Trek" franchise.

title: Dem legislation declares racism as a public health crisis in America
description: Two House Democrats put forward a resolution declaring racism to be a public health crisis in the U.S., and says people of color are getting worse care because of systemic racism.

title: Senators accuse Biden of skirting rules with ESG push, 'weaponizing' Americans' retirement funds ahead of vote
description: GOP senators slammed the Biden administration ahead of key ESG vote, accusing the administration of weaponizing Americans' retirement funds and putting their livelihoods in jeopardy.

title: Pennsylvania officials say 8-year-old boy hospitalized after hanging from neck at amusement park
description: An 8-year-old boy in Pennsylvania was sent to a local hospital after he was seen hanging from his neck unresponsive at an amusement park's rope ladder.

title: Sweet potato reportedly helps Massachusetts police crack 2011 Todd Lampley murder cold case
description: Massachusetts prosecutors say Devarus Hampton's DNA was found on a sweet potato used as a silencer at Todd Lampley's murder scene, cracking the 2011 cold case.

title: World's largest pro-life group asks Congress to investigate Planned Parenthood profits from abortion pills
description: The pro-life group 40 Days for Life wants Congress to investigate the distribution of abortion pills at retail pharmacies and whether Planned Parenthood is profiting from the sales.

title: House Dems signal opposition to declassifying info on COVID-19 origins
description: House Democratic Caucus Chairman Pete Aguilar signaled that his party would not support a bill to declassify intelligence related to the origins of the COVID-19 pandemic.

title: Maine's Bates College hires former Minnesota law school dean
description: Bates College, a liberal arts school in Maine, has tapped University of Minnesota Law School dean Garry Jenkins to be its next president.

title: Ex-Google AI expert says that 'unhinged' AI is the 'most powerful technology' since 'the atomic bomb'
description: Blake Lemoine, who was fired by Google after he claimed that the tech giant's AI engine had become sentient, is now targeting Bing's new chatbot, Bing Search.

title: Louisiana woman arrested after police find meth, puppies inside ice cream truck
description: A Louisiana woman was arrested Monday after Slidell police detectives discovered methamphetamine and two small puppies inside her ice cream truck.

title: Russia and China in unofficial arms race as US lags behind: experts
description: Experts say Russia and China are now engaged in an unofficial arms race, with the U.S. falling behind, after Russia backed out of the New START treaty last month.

description: A piece of the SS Savannah — which broke apart more than 200 years ago — was likely found on a New York shoreline following the impact of Tropical Storm Ian last fall.

description: President Biden extended the executive order declaring a "national emergency" on Wednesday pertaining to the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine.

description: Semafor announced a partnership with a Chinese think tank on Wednesday that has ties China's United Front Work Department, which operates under the CCP.

title: Illinois nurse Rebecca Bliefnick shot dead, cops search estranged husband's house
description: Rebecca Bliefnick, a 41-year-old nurse and mother of three boys, was found shot to death in her Quincy, Illinois, home on Feb. 23. There have been no arrests.

title: Shipping companies agree to pay $97M in California oil spill lawsuit
description: Shipping companies have agreed to pay $97 million in a California oil spill lawsuit. Amplify Energy acused the vessels of dragging anchors off waters and striking a pipeline in 2021.

title: US Army artillery officer dies during assignment in Thailand
description: A U.S. Army artillery officer has died during an assignment in Thailand. The man took part in a major multinational military exercise. Officals said no foul play was suspected.

title: US energy department grants $375M loan for lithium battery recycling plant
description: The U.S. Department of Energy will grant a $375 million loan to build a lithium battery recycling plant. The new plant is expected to be bulit in Casa Grande, Arizona.

description: Lori Lightfoot's critics celebrated her ousting, citing her record on crime, COVID, and the economy, saying she was the 'worst thing to ever happen to Chicago'

description: The West Virginia House has approved pay raises of 20% for the governor and five other state officials. The bill will be discussed next by the state Senate.

description: A school district in Utah is apologizing and clarifying an email sent out to educators about the proper use of sick time, and sparked a debate about mental health.

description: The West Virginia House passed a bill that would ban child marriage for anyone younger than 18. Currently, anyone as young as 16 can get married with parental consent.

description: Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador accused the chief justice of the nation's Supreme Court, Norma Piña, of promoting rulings favoring criminal suspects.

description: Jeremy Bittner, a Florida biochemist, is accused of drugging and raping two women and attempting to rape another in his Miami Beach condo called The Waverly.

description: Texas Republicans Senator Ted Cruz and Rep. Chip Roy demanded answers from AG Merrick Garland about accusations the FBI secretly recorded a progressive anti-abortion group meeting.

title: Jay Leno shows off 'new face' after suffering third-degree burns
description: Jay Leno discusses the horrific accident that led to third-degree burns on his face in a new interview.

title: Kylie Jenner’s ex Travis Scott nightclub incident: New York police investigating alleged bar brawl
description: Rapper Travis Scott allegedly got into a physical altercation with a man at a nightclub. The NYPD told Fox News Digital the "investigation is ongoing."

description: A Quinnipiac University poll revealed the voters in California do not think Governor Gavin Newsom should run for president in 2024.

description: From an exclusive docuseries on Jussie Smollett to new episodes of fan-favorite 'COPS,' Fox Nation is springing into a new season of crime-centric content.

description: Rebecca Kiessling, who lost her two sons to fentanyl, blasts Democrats for using 'false narratives' instead of facing the drug crisis on 'Fox & Friends.'

description: Poultry exports have halted in Argentina after the country detected its first case of bird flu in the industry. Most of its previous cases came from wild birds.

description: The Massachusetts governor pitched free community college for residents that are over 25 years old in her new budget proposal. The proposal also includes investments in other education.

description: A lawmaker and ally of Russian President Vladimir Putin is pushing for harsher penalties of citizens who take issue with the country’s military.

description: Attorney General Merrick Garland took heavy criticism from Sen. Ted Cruz Wednesday who accused him of politicizing the Justice Department.

description: Republicans in the House and Senate are unveiling a new proposal that would force the White House to offer its own plan for spending cuts as the debt limit fight heats up/

description: A trans video game developer recently launched a game where the main character brutally murders hordes of transgender ideology critics, including priests.

description: Ohio Gov. Mike DeWine told a camera crew on Wednesday that making East Palestine safe after February's Norfolk Southern train derailment would not happen "overnight."

title: Arizona grandmother's M&M-themed funeral casket goes viral
description: Mary Stocks Martin, a retired schoolteacher from Snowflake, Arizona, built a casket modeled after her favorite M&M years before her death. She's now buried in it.

description: Mississippi Republican Gov. Tate Reeves on Tuesday signed legislation banning gender affirming surgeries for minors, calling it a "dangerous movement" that misleads young children.

description: Prosecutor Creighton Waters delivered his closing statement Wednesday arguing that Alex Murdaugh gunned down his wife and son to escape accountability for his financial crimes.

description: India has sentenced two pharmaceutical company executives after their cough syrups were linked to the deaths of dozens of children in Gambia.

description: A Senate committee cleared an overhaul of Ohio's education system, and it could soon be put to a vote by the full Senate. The last education overhaul proposal was opposed by Democrats.

title: Italian cyclist suspended, fined after shooting death of politician's cat
description: Italian cyclist Antonio Tiberi, 21, was suspended and fined for the 2022 shooting death of his neighbor’s cat, San Marino’s former head of state Federico Pedini Amati.

description: Virginia Governor Glenn Youngkin blasted President Biden and the Democrats' handling of threats from the Chinese Communist Party.

description: Human rights lawyers are calling for an investigation into Turkish authorities accused of committing crimes against thousands of opponents of President Erdogan.

description: Texas GOP Rep. Michael Cloud reintroduced a bill to require the ATF to destroy all gun purchase records in their database and for closing gun stores to destroy their purchase records.

description: After hundreds of girls across 30 schools in Iran fell ill from poison attacks, the country’s president is ordering authorities to investigate the matter.

title: Hollywood modeling agency pressured clients into prostitution and porn, prosecutors say
description: California AG Rob Bonta announced prosecutors in the state secured a grand jury indictment against three people who allegedly ran a prostitution ring through a modeling agency.

title: Protesters descend on Maryland bar after patron claims he was banned for being an ‘old, White man’
description: Protests have erupted outside of a Boonsboro, Maryland bar where a patron claimed he and his friend were banned simply for being "old and White" men.

description: Actor Isaiah Washington announced his retirement from the business on Twitter, saying he was going to travel the country before it "falls into socialism."

description: House Republicans from the state of Texas are renewing a push to reimburse the state for its efforts to secure the border -- calling for $4.4 billion in funding.

title: Air Force signs $65M deal with startup to test 'sustainable' fuel production
description: The Department of Defense Innovation Unit and the U.S. Air Force awarded startup Air Company a contract for its sustainable aviation fuel following previous tests.

title: Florida airman who died in WWII bombing mission identified nearly 80 years later
description: U.S. Army Air Forces 2nd Lt. Pharis Weekley has been accounted for nearly 80 years after his death in World War II during a large-scale bombing mission over Romania.

title: Top Lebanese intelligence chief, mediator with Syria steps down
description: Top Lebanese intelligence chief Maj. Gen. Abbas Ibrahim will be stepping down after attempts to extend his term failed. Ibrahim has mediated the release of Westerners held in Syria.

description: House Republicans are coming down hard on Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen over what they claim is a lack of 'transparency' from the Biden administration regarding federal debt.

title: Students stranded after hotel accidentally shreds 42 passports: report
description: The lodge did not seem to provide an answer as to why it destroyed the dozens of passports left in its care by the traveling British students while on their ski trip.

description: A Wisconsin man died of a self-inflicted gunshot wound after shooting at Milwaukee police officers. No Milwaukee officers discharged their firearms during the chase.

description: After the Southern Baptist convention ousted Saddleback Church for having a female paster, the church has reaffirmed its support of women in the ministry.

description: Sen. Chuck Grassley grilled Attorney General Merrick Garland during a Judiciary Committee hearing on Wednesday about the independence of the federal Hunter Biden probe.

title: 'Wheel of Fortune' contestant scolded by Pat Sajak, ripped apart by fans
description: "Wheel of Fortune" host Pat Sajak, 76, strongly reminded an overly excited contestant of the game show's rules after she rushed to grab a one-million-dollar wedge.

title: Florida sees surge in law enforcement recruits as departments across the country struggle
description: Florida first lady Casey DeSantis announced that the Sunshine State has recruited nearly 1,400 new law enforcement officers during nationwide recruitment push.

description: Stacey Abrams, who has denied election results in America, was roasted when it was revealed she was in Nigeria to serve as an “international observer” of its election.

description: Green Bay Packers quarterback Aaron Rodgers said it's best for both sides for him to make a decision on his football future "sooner rather than later."

description: A college softball team showcased the ultimate act of sportsmanship on Saturday by helping an opponent who just hit a home run around the bases.

title: Biden spurns East Palestine again, travels to Baltimore instead
description: President Biden avoided going to East Palestine, Ohio, to survey the train derailment and toxic chemical spill, electing to travel to the House Democrat retreat in Baltimore.

title: Michigan Senate passes tax proposal, does not include $180 checks for taxpayers
description: Michigan Gov. Whitmer's initial tax plan included $180 checks for tax filers. The state Senate passed a sweeping tax proposal that did not include the checks on Tuesday.

title: Jillian Michaels suffered a spinal injury in secret that left her crawling due to pain
description: Jillian Michaels revealed the pain she felt after suffering a spinal injury in 2021 led her to "crawl on the ground" in a new interview. The celebrity trainer kept the injury a secret.

description: A clip showing Vice President Kamala Harris praising former Baltimore City State's Attorney Marilyn Mosby as doing the "right thing" has resurfaced as Mosby faces criminal charges.

description: Antonio Brown, a homeless man with a lengthy rap sheet, was indicted for the murder of 77-year-old Eleanor Bowles at her home in Buckhead, an Atlanta neighborhood pushing to secede.

title: China sends 25 warplanes, 3 ships sent toward Taiwan, island says
description: Taiwan scrambled fighter jets and activated its missile defense systems on Wednesday morning after over two dozen Chinese warplanes were spotted approaching the island.

title: Michigan police lieutenant finishes DoorDash delivery for pregnant driver after car wreck
description: Sterling Heights Police Lt. David Allen of Michigan, assisted a pregnant DoorDasher complete her delivery after she was involved in a car accident.

description: Jurors in Alex Murdaugh's double murder trial toured Moselle Wednesday for over an hour, visiting the remote property where Paul and Maggie were shot to death in 2021.

title: Virgin Islands' former top cop makes public plea after US swim champ found dead
description: The former commissioner of the U.S. Virgin Islands Police Department is asking the public to come forward with tips as crime plagues the tropical paradise.

title: AG Garland claims FBI has put 'full resources' into tracking attacks on pro-life centers, despite few arrests
description: The FBI is attempting to track and punish attacks on pro-life pregancy centers "with urgency," Attorney General Merrick Garland said Wednesday, despite few arrests on the issue.

title: Louisiana fishermen film chaotic shark feeding frenzy: 'Never seen anything like it'
description: Dillon May thought he was capturing what is known as a "tuna boil" while out on a friend's fishing boat off the coast of Louisiana. Instead, it was sharks feasting.

title: Legal immigrants infuriated by 'nefarious' DC plan to let illegal migrants vote
description: The Washington, D.C. City Council says its bill allowing noncitizens to vote in local elections is now law after the Senate failed to meet a deadline to review the legislation.

description: Dr. Gregory Jantz, psychologist and teen depression specialist, told Fox News Digital about warning signs of bad mental health advice and turning to TikTok to self-diagnose.

title: Germany presents new feminist foreign policy
description: Germany’s foreign ministers presented a new feminist policy aimed at promoting female participation in decision-making. The policy aims to create more stable societies.

title: Denver spent $8 million on migrants since December, nearly $1 million for bus tickets to other cities
description: The city of Denver has spent nearly $8 million since December on assistance to illegal migrants who are seeking asylum in Colorado or need funds to travel to another U.S. city.

title: National Park Service prompts Twitter back-and-forth over humorous advice about avoiding bear attacks
description: The National Park Service issued a humorous warning about bear attacks and prompted a back-and-forth on Twitter after urging parkgoers not to abandon their "slower" friends.

title: Rangers' K'Andre Miller suspended three games for spitting on Kings' Drew Doughty
description: New York Rangers defenseman K'Andre Miller was suspended three games for spitting on Drew Doughty of the Los Angeles Kings during Sunday's game, the league announced Wednesday.

title: United Nations condemns deployment of South Sudanese troops to disputed region of Abyei
description: United Nations officials say the deployment of South Sudanese troops to the contested Abyei region will lead to "untold suffering and humanitarian concerns."

title: 2 dead near Greece after overloaded migrant boat capsizes
description: A couple of people drowned after an overloaded migrant boat carrying 27 people capsized off a Greek island. While most were rescued, one person remains missing.

title: Florida bill would restrict gender pronouns in schools, define biological sex as an 'immutable' trait

description: After LIV Golf CEO and Commissioner Greg Norman stopped by to chat with broadcaster David Feherty, he received some high praise about his celebrity status.

title: Texas mom who drowned her kids in bathtub, hid bodies under neighbor's house sentenced to prison
description: Houston, Texas mother Sheborah Latrice Thomas was sentenced to 40 years in prison after being convicted of drowning and killing her two children in 2016.

title: Chicago ousts embattled Mayor Lori Lightfoot, as race heads to runoff without her
description: Democratic Chicago Mayor Lori Lightfoot was booted by voters during her bid for re-election as the heated race moves to a runoff in April.

title: California 'Lady in the fridge' cold case victim identified
description: California authorities have identified a woman found dead inside a refrigerator nearly 29 years ago.

title: Commanders owner Dan Snyder took secret $55 million loan, charged $4.5 million to have logo on his jet: report
description: A report says Washington Commanders owner Daniel Snyder, who is trying to sell the franchise, took out a $55 million loan without informing other team ownership stakeholders.

title: NASCAR's Kurt Busch remains out as concussion symptoms continue to linger
description: 44-year-old Kurt Busch has been working hard to try to get back on the track, but it won't be this week in Las Vegas as he continues to be ruled out with concussion symptoms.

title: Florida train carrying propane derails, officials detect no leaks
description: Florida officials say that a train carrying propane moving through the state derailed on Tuesday, but say that no leaks have been detected.

title: Image of Foo Fighters' Dave Grohl stealthily helping out at homeless shelter goes viral
description: Foo Fighters front man Dave Grohl went viral on Tuesday after it was reported that he volunteered in cooking food for 450 homeless people for over 24 hours.

title: Florida man with AK-47 posted video on social media threatening police: authorities
description: A man who posted video on social media that showed him holding an AK-47 and threatening a Miami-Dade Police officer has been arrested.

title: California man arrested for cold case murder of woman found dead in cornfield
description: The Solano County Sheriff's Office announced an arrest in the cold case murder of a 21-year-old woman who was found shot to death in a cornfield in August 1980.

title: Seahawks' Pete Carroll responds to report that Russell Wilson wanted him fired
description: At the NFL combine, Pete Carroll said he has no beefs any players who he used to coach and tried to downplay a report that Russell Wilson requested Carroll be fired.

title: California brothers found guilty in beating death of groom on wedding night
description: A pair of California brothers were found guilty of fatally beating a man to death on his wedding night.

title: Republicans call for 'full transparency' after FBI director says COVID 'most likely' originated in Chinese lab
description: Republicans have called for the release of intelligence related to the origins of COVID coming from a possible lab leak following the FBI Director Wray confirming it was the "most likely" origin.

title: Media outlets use photo from 1977 yearbook to suggest GOP governor is 'hypocritical' on drag
description: Outlets like NBC News and The Washington Post are suggesting Republican Tennessee Gov. Bill Lee is being hypocritical for cracking down on drag shows after a yearbook photo resurfaced.

title: House Republicans warn about loss of public trust after COVID lockdowns at tense roundtable
description: The Republican-led select subcommittee investigating the COVID-19 pandemic kicked off its first public event of the 118th Congress on Tuesday with a roundtable of experts.

title: Pierce Brosnan looks unrecognizable on movie set in Ireland
description: Pierce Brosnan was barely recognizable wearing a long grey wig and heavy layers while filming "Four Letters of Love" with Helena Bonham Carter in Ireland.

title: Bills defensive coordinator Leslie Frazier taking 2023 season off, expects to return next year
description: Buffalo Bills defensive coordinator Leslie Frazier is "just taking a break" from the sidelines this year but said he expects to return to coaching in 2024.

title: Transgender athlete and gender-affirming surgery bills sweep through state legislatures nationwide
description: Wyoming joins a growing list of states seeking to ban or that has banned trans athletes from competing in sports while other states have banned gender-affirming care for minors.

title: Biden Labor secretary nominee oversaw billions of dollars lost in unemployment fraud as Newsom Cabinet member
description: President Biden will nominate Deputy Secretary of Labor Julie Su, California’s former labor chief, to head the U.S. Department of Labor, the White House said Tuesday.

title: Truck driver ticketed over Vermont train crash
description: The driver of a tractor-trailer struck by an Amtrak train in Vermont on Monday has been ticketed for attempting to cross railroad tracks when doing so was unsafe.

title: Bisexual women may face a higher heart disease risk, new research suggests
description: A recent study suggests bisexual women may have poorer cardiovascular health (CVH) and a higher risk of heart disease than heterosexual females. Researchers analyzed data from 12,180 people.

title: Wisconsin GOP likely to drop flat tax from budget
description: Republicans in the Wisconsin Legislature are unlikely to include a 3.25% flat income tax, a plan which Democratic Gov. Tony Evers vocally opposes, in the state budget this year.

title: Polls close in Chicago as voters decide political fate of Mayor Lori Lightfoot amid crime wave
description: Polls have closed in Chicago as incumbent Democratic Mayor Lori Lightfoot faces a tough re-election bid with challenges from eight candidates amid a soaring crime rate across the city.

title: 'I'm going to stick to God:' Hearing erupts as Rep. Bishop condemns Democrats' 'modern view' of religion
description: North Carolina Representative Dan Bishop called out the Democratic Party for its 'modern view' regarding religion, which he says they believe to be 'passé.'

title: Chaos breaks out after anti-war protestors booted from House China Committee hearing
description: Two protestors holding sings that read "China is not our enemy" and "Stop Asian hate" disrupted the first House China Select Committee on Tuesday night.

title: Indiana authorities offer up to $500 for leads on bald eagle's killer
description: Indiana conservation officers are offering up to $500 as a reward for leads on an individual who shot and killed a bald eagle in Dubois County on Saturday.

title: Pirates-Orioles spring training game finishes with no umpires in unnecessary bottom of 9th inning
description: The Pirates beat the Orioles in spring training Tuesday. But, after a quick discussion between managers, they decided to keep playing and the umpires didn't decide to stay.

title: Baltimore's former top prosecutor Marilyn Mosby has trial delayed after entire defense team quits
description: The perjury trial of Marilyn Mosby, Baltimore's former top prosecutor, was delayed again on Monday to November after her entire defense team quit last month.

title: Kansas man gets 25 years for shooting at police during Floyd demonstration
description: Henry Parker, 30, of Wichita, Kansas, was sentenced to 25 years in prison for shooting at police during a protest over the death of George Floyd.

title: Political tensions flare in Nigeria as early election results come in
description: As Nigerian elections officials continue rolling out results, political tensions in Africa's most populated country are beginning to rise as multiple parties claim victory.

title: Former NFL groundskeeper believes overwatering triggered Super Bowl LVII field's issues
description: Field quality became an issue after several players had difficulty with their footing during the game, and a longtime groundskeeper believes the grass was watered too much.

title: Florida man who allegedly beat shark with hammer faces charges
description: A Florida man who allegedly beat a shark is being charged, authorities said Tuesday.

title: Shakira says there's a 'place in hell' for women who don't support women after ex goes official with new gf
description: Shakira shaded her ex's new girlfriend in a recent interview, saying that "there's a special place in hell" for women who are unsupportive of other women.

title: FOX Weather expands to Optimum, Spectrum, LG Channels
description: FOX Weather president Sharri Berg announced Tuesday that the streaming service is now on Optimum, Spectrum and LG Channels, becoming more available for Americans.

title: No water access in New Jersey city after main break
description: Water access in Hoboken, New Jersey has been limited since a construction crew broke a main in the city, located across the Hudson River from Manhattan.

title: Motive for Albuquerque double homicide still unknown
description: Police have determined a shooting in Albuquerque last week to be a double homicide and a suicide, but the motive is still unknown. The two victims were found with multiple stab wounds.

title: Irregular sleep could put you in the danger zone for heart disease: study
description: Those who go to bed and wake up at different times or have disrupted sleep could face a higher risk of heart disease, according to a new study from the American Heart Association.

title: Biden takes aim at MAGA Republicans in Virginia Beach health care speech: 'Different breed of cat'
description: President Biden claimed that "MAGA Republicans" are a "different breed of cat" during a speech In Virginia Beach on Tuesday focusing on health care.

title: West Virginia GOP auditor announces 2024 run for governor
description: West Virginia's GOP auditor JB McCuskey announced Tuesday his 2024 run for governor. This is McCuskey's second term as auditor and no Democrats have announced plans to seek the office.

title: Rubio, Warner displeased with 'Gang of Eight' briefing on classified docs: 'Left much to be desired'
description: Two senators expressed displeasure after a "Gang of Eight" briefing they received concerning the alleged mishandling of classified documents.

title: Oregon bill would pay homeless people $1,000 a month
description: The Oregon state legislature is weighing a bill to give $1,000 universal basic income payments to homeless and low-income residents in universal basic income.

title: Buccaneers expected to release Leonard Fournette before start of new league year: report
description: Leonard Fournette asked for his release from the Tampa Bay Buccaneers, and they are reportedly going to fulfill his wish before the start of the new league year March 15.

title: Fran Drescher touts the end of vaccine mandates during SAG speech: ‘money talks and bulls--t walks'
description: 'The Nanny' star Fran Drescher alludes to the end of vaccine mandates in Hollywood and signals her support for the move during SAG awards speech.
